Chapter 25, Part 5: The Ten Dedications
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their flesh-covered cranial protrusions and topknots, like Bodhisattva RatnacÅ«á¸a, Bodhisattva SuÅ›ubha-kÄya, and other innumerable bodhisattvas.
When bodhisattvas see beggars coming, they are overjoyed and say to them:
'If you need my flesh-covered cranial protrusion and topknot, you may take it from me.
This topknot of mine is the best in JambudvÄ«pa.'

When they say this, their minds are undisturbed, they do not think of other activities, they abandon the world and aspire for tranquility, they are ultimately pure, diligent and sincere, and they head towards omniscience;
Then he took a sharp knife, cut off the skin of the topknot on his head, placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms, and single-mindedly gave it away;
mindful of the practices of all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the three times, he gave rise to great joy and increased his superior aspiration;
his mind well understood the teachings, he did not grasp at suffering, and he knew that painful feelings are signless and unborn, and that all feelings arise and cease without abiding permanently;

'Therefore, I should practice great giving like all Bodhisattvas of the past, present, and future, give rise to deep faith and joy, seek omniscience without turning back, and not rely on the power of others or spiritual benefactors.
' When the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva makes this offering, he thus dedicates the roots of goodness, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain the invisible crown of the head and accomplish the topknot of Bodhisattvas like a stupa;
May all sentient beings attain dark blue hair, vajra hair, fine and soft hair, and be able to extinguish all the afflictions of sentient beings.

May all sentient beings attain moist hair, dense hair, and hair that does not invade the temples and forehead.ğŸ”½May all sentient beings attain soft hair, hair that grows on the temples and forehead.
May all sentient beings attain hair like the swastika symbol, hair that spirals to the right like a conch shell.
May all sentient beings attain the Buddha's hair, forever free from all afflictive karmic habits;
May all sentient beings attain hair with radiance, its light universally illuminating the worlds in the ten directions;
May all sentient beings attain hair without disorder, hair like the TathÄgata's, pure and wondrous, without impurity;
May all sentient beings attain hair like the crown stupa of the Worthy of Offerings, causing those who see it to be like seeing the Buddha's hair;
May all sentient beings attain the TathÄgata's hair without attachment, forever free from all darkness, obscurations, and defilements.
This is the dedication of wholesome roots by bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas when giving their flesh-covered hair-knots;
in order to cause sentient beings' minds to be tranquil, to all attain the various dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, and to ultimately realize the TathÄgata's omniscience and the ten powers.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their eyes to those who come to beg, like the bodhisattva who practices with joy, the king of moonlight, and the other innumerable bodhisattvas who practice giving.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their eyes, they give rise to a pure mind of giving eyes, a pure mind of the eye of wisdom, a mind that relies on the light of the Dharma, a mind that manifests the unsurpassed Buddha path, a mind that aspires to the vast wisdom of dedication, a mind that equally gives with the bodhisattvas of the three times, a mind that gives rise to unobstructed eyes and indestructible pure faith, and a mind of joy and acceptance towards those who beg;

In order to perfect all spiritual powers, to give rise to the Buddha eye, to expand the great mind of enlightenment, to cultivate great compassion, and to subdue the six sense faculties, one gives rise to this mind towards such dharmas.
Buddha's disciple!
When the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives away his eyes, he gives rise to love and joy towards the beggar, establishes a gathering, and increases the power of the Dharma;
He abandons worldly love, views, and indulgence, cuts off the bonds of desire, and cultivates enlightenment;
According to their requests, his mind is at ease and unmoving, not going against their wishes, satisfying them all, and always following the practice of non-dual giving.
He dedicates these wholesome roots in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain the supreme eye and guide all;
May all sentient beings attain unobstructed eyes and open the treasury of wisdom;
May all sentient beings attain the pure physical eye, with light penetrating through, and nothing able to obstruct it;
May all sentient beings attain the pure heavenly eye, and see the karmic consequences of sentient beings' birth and death;
May all sentient beings attain the pure Dharma eye, and be able to enter the realm of the TathÄgatas in accordance with the teachings;
May all sentient beings attain the eye of wisdom, and abandon all discriminating attachments;
May all sentient beings be endowed with the Buddha eye, and be able to awaken to all dharmas;
May all sentient beings attain the universal eye, and reach the limits of all realms without obstruction;
May all sentient beings be endowed with the pure eye free from the cataract of delusion, and understand that the realm of sentient beings is empty and non-existent;
May all sentient beings be endowed with the pure eye free from obstruction, and attain the ultimate ten powers of the TathÄgata.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of merit when giving eyes, in order to enable sentient beings to attain the pure eye of omniscience.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are able to give their ears and nose to beggars, like Bodhisattva King of Supreme Conduct, Bodhisattva Victorious Over Enemies, and the other innumerable bodhisattvas.
When practicing generosity, they associate with beggars and single-mindedly cultivate the practices of bodhisattvas;

Endowed with the Buddha-nature, born in the TathÄgata family, they contemplate the practices of generosity cultivated by bodhisattvas, always diligently giving rise to the enlightenment of the buddhas, and purifying their faculties, merits, wisdom;
Observing the three realms of existence, there is not a single thing that is solid;
They vow to always get to see buddhas and bodhisattvas, and in accordance with their recollection, to remember all the Buddha's teachings;
Knowing that the body is illusory, empty, and non-existent, they have nothing to be greedy or stingy about.
When bodhisattvas practice generosity in this way, giving their ears and nose, their minds are always tranquil and they subdue their faculties;
They rescue sentient beings from perilous and evil difficulties, and give rise to all wisdom and merits;
They enter the great ocean of generosity, understand the Dharma and its meaning, and fully cultivate all paths;
Relying on wisdom, one attains mastery of the Dharma and exchanges the impermanent body for the firm and solid body.
Buddha's disciple!
When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their ears, they dedicate the roots of goodness in this way:
'May all sentient beings attain unobstructed ears and hear the sounds of all Dharma teachings;
May all sentient beings attain unobstructed ears and be able to understand all sounds;
May all sentient beings attain the ears of the TathÄgata, with all their intelligence and without any obstruction;
May all sentient beings attain pure ears and not give rise to discriminating thoughts based on the ear faculty;
May all sentient beings attain ears free from deafness and dullness, causing ignorant consciousness to cease forever;
May all sentient beings attain ears pervading the Dharma realm and know all the sounds of the Buddhas' Dharma;
May all sentient beings attain unobstructed ears and awaken to all unobstructed Dharmas;
May all sentient beings attain indestructible ears, skillfully understand all treatises, and be indestructible;
May all sentient beings attain all-hearing ears, vast and pure, becoming the king of all ears;
May all sentient beings be endowed with the divine ear and the Buddha's ear.'
This is how bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, when giving ears, dedicate the wholesome roots, in order to enable sentient beings to all attain pure ears.
Buddha's disciple!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give noses, they make the following dedications:

'May all sentient beings attain a prominent nose, a well-proportioned nose, a good-looking nose, a delightful nose, a pure and wondrous nose, a compliant nose, a prominent nose, a nose that subdues enemies, a well-seeing nose, and a TathÄgata's nose;

May all sentient beings attain a face free from anger, attain the face of all dharmas, attain an unobstructed face, attain a well-seen face, attain a compliant face, attain a pure face, attain a face free from faults, attain the fully endowed face of the TathÄgata, attain a face pervading all places, attain a face of immeasurable beauty.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the wholesome roots of giving the nose, in order to cause all sentient beings to ultimately enter the buddhadharmas, in order to cause sentient beings to ultimately embrace the buddhadharmas, in order to cause sentient beings to ultimately understand the buddhadharmas, in order to cause sentient beings to ultimately uphold the buddhadharmas, in order to cause sentient beings to ultimately always see the tathÄgatas,

Buddha's disciple!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abiding in the stage of firm and solid earth can give their teeth to sentient beings, just like the bodhisattvas Flower Teeth King and Six Tusked Elephant King, as well as the innumerable other bodhisattvas.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their teeth, their minds are pure, rare and difficult to obtain like an udumbara flower.
Namely:

giving with an inexhaustible mind, giving with a greatly faithful mind, giving with an immeasurable mind of renunciation accomplished step by step, giving with a mind that subdues the senses, giving with a mind that relinquishes everything, giving with a mind that vows for omniscience, giving with a mind that brings happiness to sentient beings, great giving, ultimate giving, excellent giving, supreme giving, giving without resentment even when giving away one's own life.
At that time, the bodhisattva dedicates all roots of goodness in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain sharp and white teeth, become the most excellent stupa, and receive offerings from gods and humans;
may all sentient beings attain evenly aligned teeth, like the excellent marks of a buddha, without any gaps;
may all sentient beings attain a mind of self-control, the bodhisattva practices of the ten wholesome courses of action;
may all sentient beings have a mouth that is well-purified, with teeth that are fresh and white, clearly manifest;
May all sentient beings attain teeth adorned with memories, their mouths pure, without any unpleasant appearances;
May all sentient beings attain forty complete teeth, always emitting various wonderful fragrances;
May the minds of all sentient beings be well-tamed, their teeth as fresh and clean as white lotus flowers, with swirling patterns and the auspicious svastika mark;
May the lips of all sentient beings be fresh and pure, their teeth white and clean, emitting immeasurable light shining everywhere;
May the teeth of all sentient beings be firm and sharp, with no whole grains in their food, not attached to flavors, becoming the supreme field of blessings;
May all sentient beings always emit light between their teeth, bestowing the foremost prediction upon all bodhisattvas.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving teeth;
In order to enable sentient beings to possess omniscience and have pure wisdom in all dharmas.
Buddha's disciple!

When a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva encounters someone who comes to beg for his tongue, he should have a compassionate mind towards the beggar, speak to him with gentle and loving words, just as in the past the Bodhisattva Ugradatta, the Bodhisattva Avaivartika, and the innumerable other bodhisattvas did.
Buddha's disciple!
When a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva takes birth in the various realms, there are innumerable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of beings who come to beg for his tongue.

At that time, the bodhisattva places them in a lion seat, with a mind free from anger, a mind free from harm, a mind free from resentment, a mind of great authority, a mind born from the Buddha's lineage, a mind abiding in the bodhisattva's abode, an always untroubled mind, a mind abiding in great power, a mind unattached to the body, and a mind unattached to speech. He kneels on the ground, opens his mouth, sticks out his tongue, and shows it to the beggar;
with a compassionate mind, he speaks to him with gentle words, saying:
'This body of mine now belongs to all of you.
You may take my tongue and use it as you wish;
May your wishes all be fulfilled.'
At that time, the Bodhisattva dedicated all his roots of goodness in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain a universal tongue, able to proclaim all languages and teachings;
May all sentient beings attain a tongue that covers the face, speaking truthfully without contradiction;
May all sentient beings attain a tongue that covers all buddha-lands, manifesting the spiritual powers and freedom of the buddhas;
May all sentient beings attain a soft and thin tongue, always receiving the most delicious and pure flavors;
May all sentient beings attain a tongue of eloquence, able to sever all worldly doubts and entanglements;
May all sentient beings attain a tongue of light, able to emit countless millions of billions of lights;
May all sentient beings attain a definitive tongue, explaining the teachings without end;
May all sentient beings attain a universally disciplined tongue, skillfully revealing all secrets, and may all their words be accepted with faith.
May all sentient beings attain a tongue that universally understands, skillfully entering the ocean of all languages.
May all sentient beings attain a tongue that skillfully expounds all Dharma gates, and may they reach the other shore of verbal cognition.
This is the dedication of the roots of goodness when Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their tongues, in order to enable sentient beings to all attain unobstructed cognition.
Buddha's disciple!

When Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their heads to those who come to request them, it is like the practice of giving by the Bodhisattva Supreme Wisdom, the Great Man King of KÄÅ›i, and other great bodhisattvas;

In order to accomplish the foremost wisdom that enters all dharmas, in order to accomplish the foremost of great enlightenment that saves sentient beings, in order to be fully endowed with the foremost of seeing all dharmas, in order to attain the foremost wisdom of right view, in order to accomplish the foremost of unobstructedness, in order to realize the foremost of the first ground, in order to seek the foremost wisdom that is supreme in the world, in order to accomplish the foremost pure wisdom that is invisible at the peak of the three realms, in order to manifest the foremost wisdom that reaches everywhere in the ten directions, in order to fulfill all dharmas that are invincible and sovereign.
Buddha's disciple!
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in this dharma and diligently cultivate it, then they will have already entered the Buddha's lineage and learned the Buddha's giving;
They will give rise to pure faith in the buddhas and increase their wholesome roots;
They will cause all beggars to attain satisfaction;
Their minds will be pure and their joy immeasurable;
with a pure and believing mind, illuminating the Buddha's teachings;
giving rise to the intention for enlightenment, abiding in the mind of abandonment;
with faculties delighted, merit and virtue increasing;
giving rise to wholesome desires, always delighting in practicing vast giving.
At that time, the bodhisattva dedicates all roots of goodness in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain the head of the TathÄgata, attain the invisible crown of the head;
be unobstructed everywhere, foremost in all buddha-lands;
with hair curling to the right, radiant and lustrous, adorned with the svastika pattern, rare in the world;
endowed with the Buddha's head, accomplishing the head of wisdom, the foremost head in all worlds, the complete head, the pure head, the head of perfect wisdom seated at the site of enlightenment.'
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of roots of goodness when giving away the head;
in order to enable sentient beings to attain the supreme Dharma and accomplish unsurpassed great wisdom.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their hands and feet to sentient beings, like Bodhisattva Always Diligent, King Without Sorrow, and other innumerable bodhisattvas.
In various destinies and birthplaces, they give their hands and feet, using faith as their hands to engage in beneficial practices;
Going back and forth, diligently cultivating the true Dharma, wishing to attain the precious hand and give with their hands;
Their actions are not in vain, they perfect the bodhisattva path, always extending their hands to bestow vast wisdom;
They walk with ease, courageous and fearless, with the power of pure faith they perfect energetic practice, eliminating evil destinies and accomplishing enlightenment.
Buddha's disciple!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give in this way, with an immeasurable, boundless, vast mind, they open the gate of pure Dharma and enter the ocean of buddhas;
They perfect the giving hand and provide for the ten directions;
They uphold the path of omniscience with the power of vows, abiding in the ultimately pure mind;
The Dharma body and wisdom body are unbroken and indestructible, and all demonic activities cannot sway them;
Relying on good and wise advisors, they firmly establish their minds and practice giving together with the bodhisattvas.
Buddha's disciple!
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva seeks omniscience for the sake of all beings and gives away their hands and feet, they direct the roots of goodness in this way:
'May all sentient beings possess the power of spiritual abilities and attain the precious hands;
Having attained the precious hands, they should respect each other, give rise to the thought of a field of blessings, and make offerings to each other with various treasures;

Moreover, they should make offerings to the buddhas with many treasures, producing wonderful clouds of treasures that pervade the lands of the buddhas, causing all sentient beings to give rise to thoughts of kindness towards each other, not harming each other;
They should travel to the buddha-lands, abide fearlessly, and naturally perfect the ultimate spiritual abilities.'

May they all attain jeweled hands, flower hands, fragrant hands, cloth hands, parasol hands, flower garland hands, powdered incense hands, adornment hands, boundless hands, immeasurable hands, universal hands;

Having attained these hands, with the power of spiritual penetrations they always diligently go to all buddha-lands, able to touch all buddha-worlds with one hand, holding sentient beings with their sovereign hands, emitting immeasurable light from their wondrous hands, able to universally cover sentient beings with one hand, accomplishing the webbed fingers and copper-colored nails of the TathÄgata.
' At that time, the bodhisattva universally covers sentient beings with his great vow hand:

'May all sentient beings always delight in seeking unsurpassed enlightenment, giving rise to the great ocean of all merits, seeing those who come to beg with joy and without aversion, entering the ocean of the Buddha's teachings and sharing in the Buddha's wholesome roots.'
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving hands and feet.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas destroy their bodies, draw blood, and give it to sentient beings, like Dharma-karma Bodhisattva, Good Intention King Bodhisattva, and the other innumerable bodhisattvas.

When giving their bodies and blood in various realms, they give rise to the mind to accomplish omniscience, give rise to the mind to revere great enlightenment, give rise to the mind to enjoy cultivating bodhisattva practices, give rise to the mind not to grasp suffering, give rise to the mind to enjoy seeing beggars, give rise to the mind not to dislike beggars coming, give rise to the mind to head towards all bodhisattva paths, give rise to the mind to protect and maintain all bodhisattvas' giving, give rise to the mind to increase bodhisattvas' good giving, give rise to the mind of non-retrogression, the mind of non-cessation, and the mind of no attachment to self;
They dedicate all wholesome roots in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain the Dharma body and wisdom body;
May all sentient beings attain a body free from fatigue, like vajra;
May all sentient beings attain an indestructible body, unharmed by others;
May all sentient beings attain a body like an illusion, manifesting everywhere in the world without end;
May all sentient beings attain a body that is delightful, pure, and firm;
May all sentient beings attain a body born from the Dharma realm, the same as the TathÄgata, without any basis;
May all sentient beings attain a body with the light of wondrous jewels, which no one in the world can surpass;
May all sentient beings attain a body of wisdom, freely mastering the realm of immortality;
May all sentient beings attain a body like a precious ocean, seeing which brings benefit, with none passing by in vain;
May all sentient beings attain a body like space, worldly afflictions and suffering unable to taint or attach to it.

' This is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving blood, with a mind of the Great Vehicle, a pure mind, a vast mind, a joyful mind, a fortunate mind, a delighted mind, an exalted mind, a mind of peace and bliss, and an untainted mind.
Buddha's disciple!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas see someone begging for their marrow and flesh, they joyfully speak softly to the beggar, saying:
'Take my marrow and flesh as you wish and use them.'
Like the Bodhisattva of Abundant Benefits, the Bodhisattva King of Universal Giving, and the other innumerable bodhisattvas.
When they give their marrow and flesh to beggars in various realms of existence and birthplaces, their joy is vast, and the mind of giving grows;
They cultivate wholesome roots together with the bodhisattvas, free from worldly defilements, and attain profound aspirations;
They give their bodies everywhere, their minds are inexhaustible;
They are endowed with immeasurable vast wholesome roots, embracing all the treasures of wondrous merits, and like the bodhisattva Dharma, they practice without weariness;
Their minds always delight in the merits of giving, providing for all without regret;
They carefully observe that all dharmas arise from conditions and have no self-nature, and do not crave the acts of giving and the rewards of those acts;
They give equally to whomever they encounter.
Buddha's disciple!
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives in this way, all buddhas appear before him, thinking of him as their father and receiving him with protection;
all sentient beings appear before him, universally causing them to abide in the pure Dharma;
all worlds appear before him, adorning all buddha-lands;
all sentient beings appear before him, universally saving and protecting them with a mind of great compassion;
all buddha paths appear before him, delighting in contemplating the TathÄgata's ten powers;
all bodhisattvas of the past, present, and future appear before him, universally fulfilling all wholesome roots together;
all forms of fearlessness appear before him, able to make the supreme lion's roar;
all of the three times appear before him, attaining impartial wisdom and universally observing.
all worlds are manifest before them, because they give rise to vast vows to cultivate enlightenment for the duration of the future;
all bodhisattvas' practices without weariness are manifest before them, because they give rise to immeasurable vast minds.
Buddha's disciple!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give away their marrow and flesh, they dedicate the wholesome roots in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain a vajra body that cannot be destroyed;
may all sentient beings attain a firm and compact body that is always without deficiency;
may all sentient beings attain a body born from the mind, just like the Buddha's body, pure and adorned;
may all sentient beings attain a body with the marks of a hundred merits, adorned with the thirty-two marks;
may all sentient beings attain a body adorned with the eighty minor marks, endowed with the ten powers, indestructible;
may all sentient beings attain the TathÄgata's body, ultimately pure and immeasurable;
May all sentient beings attain a firm body that cannot be destroyed by any demons or enemies;
May all sentient beings attain a body with a single characteristic, with the same bodily characteristics as the buddhas of the three times;
May all sentient beings attain an unobstructed body, pervading the realm of space with their pure Dharma body;
May all sentient beings attain a body that is a treasury of enlightenment, universally able to contain all worlds.

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when seeking omniscience and giving away marrow and flesh, in order to enable sentient beings to all attain the TathÄgata's ultimately pure immeasurable body.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their minds to those who come begging, like the bodhisattvas Regretless and Unimpeded King, and the other innumerable great bodhisattvas.

When giving one's own mind to beggars, one studies the mind of freely giving, cultivates the mind of giving everything, practices the mind of the perfection of giving, accomplishes the mind of the perfection of giving, studies the mind of all bodhisattvas' giving, the mind of giving up everything without remainder, the mind of habitually giving everything, the mind of carrying out the practices of all bodhisattvas, the mind of correctly recollecting all buddhas appearing before one, and the mind of making offerings to all beggars without interruption.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give in this way, their minds are pure. It is for the sake of delivering all sentient beings, for the sake of attaining the place of enlightenment with the ten powers, for the sake of practicing in accordance with great vows, for the sake of abiding in the bodhisattva path, for the sake of accomplishing omniscience, and for the sake of not abandoning one's original vows. They dedicate all wholesome roots in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain the adamantine treasury mind, which cannot be destroyed by any adamantine mountain or other things;
May all sentient beings attain the mind adorned with the svastika-patterned adamantine realm, attain the mind that cannot be shaken,
attain the fearless mind, attain the mind that always benefits the world without exhaustion, attain
the mind of the treasury of wisdom like a great valiant banner, attain the mind of firm resolve like NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, attain
the inexhaustible mind like the ocean of sentient beings, attain the indestructible mind like the treasury of NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, attain
the mind that eliminates the activities and armies of MÄra, attain the fearless mind, attain the mind of great authority,

attain the mind of constant diligence, attain the mind of great valor, attain the mind free from fear,ğŸ”½attain the mind of wearing adamantine armor, attain the supreme mind of all bodhisattvas, attain the mind that accomplishes
the light of enlightenment of the Buddha Dharma, attain the mind of sitting under the bodhi tree and abiding in the correct
The Dharma is free from all delusions and accomplishes the mind of omniscience, and attains the mind of accomplishing the ten powers.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving the mind;
In order to cause sentient beings to be unstained by the world and to be fully endowed with the TathÄgata's mind of the ten powers.
Buddha's disciple!

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are begged for their intestines, kidneys, liver, and lungs, they give them all, just like the bodhisattvas Good Giving, Subduing Demons, and Sovereign King, as well as the other innumerable great bodhisattvas.
When practicing this giving, seeing a beggar come, their mind is joyful, and they observe with loving eyes;
In pursuit of enlightenment, they give everything they need, without any regret in their mind.
They observe that this body is not solid:
'I should give to them and take a solid body.'
They further think that this body will soon decay and become disgusting to see, to be eaten by foxes, wolves, and starving dogs;
This body is impermanent and will surely be abandoned, to be eaten by others, without any awareness.
Buddha's disciple!

When the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva contemplates in this way, he knows that the body is impermanent and extremely filthy. With understanding and joy in the Dharma, he respectfully looks at those who come to beg, thinking of them as good friends and protectors, and gives them whatever they seek, exchanging his impermanent body for a permanent one.
Buddha's disciple!
When the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives in this way, he dedicates all his wholesome roots, thinking:
'May all sentient beings attain a body that is a treasury of wisdom, pure inside and out;

May all sentient beings attain a firm and solid body, their bodies true and real, always without decay or destruction;

Just like in the past, the bodhisattva Pure Treasury, the bodhisattva Golden-flanked Deer King, and the other innumerable great bodhisattvas, without any difference.
At that time, the Bodhisattva dedicates all roots of goodness in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain subtle skin, just like the TathÄgata's pure appearance and form, which those who see are never sated with;

May all sentient beings attain golden skin, like the finest gold from the JambÅ« River, pure and clear;

' This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving fingers, in order to cause all sentient beings to attain pure minds.

Like Bodhisattva King of Seeking Dharma Sovereignty, Bodhisattva of Inexhaustibility, and other innumerable great bodhisattvas, in order to seek the Dharma, wishing to use the true Dharma to reveal, expound, and benefit sentient beings, causing all to attain fulfillment, they all gave their flesh and nails to beggars.

'May all sentient beings attain the copper-colored Buddha-nails;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings attain moist nails adorned with auspicious marks;

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are in a king's position seeking the true Dharma, even if it is only for a single character, a single word, a single phrase, or a single meaning, they give rise to the thought of difficulty in obtaining and are able to completely give up everything within the ocean, whether near or far, including the country, cities, people, treasuries, storehouses, gardens, ponds, houses, trees, forests, flowers, fruits, and even all precious and wonderful objects, palaces, towers, wives, children, relatives, and even the king's position, all of which they are able to give up.

Forever leaving behind all worldly idle chatter, they abide in the Buddhas' dharmas free from idle chatter.

in order to cause sentient beings to know and see the perfection, and always be able to abide in the path of peace and security.
